result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Conar Craden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Psilocin(<=100g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(g)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of extended supervision are the same as the conditions of probation.

miscConds.notes: lf extended supervision is revoked and the defendant will have a mandatory release from prison, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol.

Defendant shall not possess/consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.  

Defendant shall not possess or use more than one cell phone/cell number.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments, and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent, and shall complete any recommended treatment.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice. 

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same. 

Court authorizes transfer to jail convenient to employment/residence.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joseph Conar Craden in court.  Attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein in court for Joseph Conar Craden.  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Argument from State and counsel.  Statements from def.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
Letter received from Atty Rothstein with attachment

Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph Conar Craden in court.  Attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein in court for Joseph Conar Craden. Reading of Amended Info waived.  State moves to amend charge to Fel Man/Deliver Psilocin <=100g, 961.41(1)(g)1; Court so orders.  Case is then resolved w/def free to argue re condition time.  State makes the following recommendation:  1 1/2 yrs WSP + 2 1/2 yrs ES stayed for 3 yrs probation, 6 mos co jail w/huber as condition time, AODA, counseling per agent, absolute sobriety, not possess/use any controlled substance without a valid prescription, $268 court costs, $250 DNA surcharge, DNA sample, full-time employment, schooling or both, def to reimburse $700 buy money.  Def enters guilty plea to Ct 1 as amended.  Court finds def guilty on amended Ct 1 and adj sentencing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on September 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
